info.title: De Trafford Arms
info.address: 2 Congleton Rd, Alderley Edge SK9 7AA, United Kingdom

data.text:
Myself and my partner stayed for just one night while visiting the area.  The village looked beautiful with all the trees lit up for Christmas and lots of restaurants and quirky style shops to spend your time in.
At the hotel we were checked in by a pleasant gentleman who gave us all the information needed for the pub food and closing  times and hotel details. The room was quite small but big enough to fit a super king size bed. It was clean and warm and had an extremely
powerful shower. We dined in the restaurant later in the evening but be sure to order by 8.45 before the kitchen closes. The service and food was good if not a little expensive and plenty options available for your choice of tipple with a pint of Madre knocking on Â£6.50-ish. The breakfast was hot, tasty and ideal for a big appetite, its very big!  The seating/dining area has little rooms dotted about all with chunky beams and character. All in all we had a lovely stay and if in the area again we would definitely stay here again.
(A thank you to the guy at the end of the night who took a picture of us in the grotto)
data.name: Jo Brown
data.responseFromOwnerText:
So pleased that you enjoyed your stay and had a fantastic time in the village especially our pub and hotel.
Look forward to seeing you again soon.

data.text: Went for a Friday lunchtime meal. It was practically empty. The decor and food were both good. The bar staff were friendly and helpful. The waitress service was good until the bill came when I asked to use Tesco vouchers. The waitress obviously sighed and said she would have to cancel the bill. That took a couple of seconds and she proceeded to scan my vouchers which again, in the empty restaurant, took a matter of seconds. I asked how much had I paid and she sighed again and told me in a negative tone how much etc. I suspect that her problem was that she did not expect a tip as surely it could not be the "workload" as the place was empty. I settled up the balance and did not tip. It is a long time since I haven't given the customary 10% whether by card or cash. I am still going to give her a tip albeit belated. My tip is not a monetary one but some advice. Be polite and don't let the restaurant down.

data.text:
5/5 - We stopped in here for an evening meal (me my wife and 2 daughters) on the evening of 11/03. We were there for the trampoline competition at Kings School Macclesfield the following day.

What can i say, except absolutely fantastic! A really pleasant setting, very relaxed atmosphere inside the place - just what i like.

The food was fantastic, absolutely fantastic. It was served nice and hot, on time and with a smile and chat from all the waiting staff who dealt with us.

We arrived 20 mins early for our booking and fully expected to be told to wait and come back, but no, the check in lady offered us to go to the bar and have drink before our table opened up, this was very welcome considering i'd driven for nearly 2 hours to get there.

our table opened up and the experience just kept getting better and better. we were waited on by 3 different people, each was as attentive/polite and courteous as the next.

We had a starter to share, 2 main adult meals, 2 kids meals + puddings, + 4 kids drinks and 2 alcohol drinks - total bill Â£59.60 (absolutely fantastic value)

5/5* for the food
5/5* for the staff
5/5* for the pub itself
5/5* for the ample free parking

If we are in Macclesfield any time in the future, we will be sure to come here again.

data.text: Whether travelling for business or leisure the De Trafford ticks all the boxes, I spent a lot of time travelling for work from May 2019 5 days a week, so needed somewhere to stay with a friendly welcoming atmosphere, excellent comfortable rooms, great food and more importantly friendly and welcoming staff, the De Trafford provides this in abundance. From the moment I first checked in, I was made to feel at home by the amazing staff led by Gill and Hannah. The hotel is situated in the very affluent area of Alderley Edge which has many excellent restaurants, but I very rarely feel the need to drift away from the excellent and very comprehensive menu at the De Trafford. The pub itself has a warm and friendly atmosphere with plenty of choice of drinks although I have my usual tipple which is always efficiently topped up ðð and as I travel alone there is always a friendly face to strike up a conversation with either the fantastic staff or the friendly customers. During Covid they all worked so hard to  create an extremely clean and safe environment. Unfortunately I donât have the need to commute for work as regularly as I did pre Covid but when I do commute I have no hesitation in booking into the De Trafford where I always get a amazing welcome from whom some have become fantastic friends. The hotel is in a perfect location for business being close to Manchester and the airport and also for leisure as a great place to explore the delights of Cheshire and the Peak District. I would certainly recommend this hotel as a great place to stay. In fact I will be visiting next week and canât wait to be back there ðð

data.text:
Visited 16/07/2021
This was the first time visiting De Trafford Arms, I had been to a Chef and Brewer before and this place was around the same size, the menu I expected to be the same but it had slightly changed - I assume because of the season.

Me and my Mum are both Vegetarians and even though there are a lot of dessert options suitable there was only a couple of main options that we didn't fancy, we normally fall on to the Mushroom Stilton on Sourbread dish but this has now changed to Garlic Mushroom on Crumpet with a Mustard Stick. (See photo) in my opinion this is just a very stranged mixed dish, the Crumpet itself wasn't overly hot and the Mustard Stick just made it look weird.... It was ok to eat but nothing to write home about. The chips were hot, the Caramalised Onion, Tomoto, Feta Tart was freezing - I am assuming Tarts are served this way but it would have been 100 times better if it had been hot or even Luke warm.

My Dad had Cod and chips and he said it was very hot and it was a nice portion size.

For dessert we had Bakewell Tart and Custard which was BEAUTIFUL!! The best part of the whole visit. My Dad had Millionaire Cheesecake and Ice cream which he also enjoyed.

The member of staff was very nice, she read out all of the ice cream options as well and she was very pleasant.

The place itself is nice, we felt like it was very clean and there were lots of Hand Sanitiser Stations etc. The toilets were also very clean!

Would come back again but I do wish there were more Vegetarian options or better Starters ð

data.text: I have just returned from a lovely weekend with four family members at this delightful hotel. All four of us were very impressed by the standards maintained at this three star establishment. We could not fault the attitude, friendliness and willingness to please displayed by all the staff. We had two breakfasts and one evening meal in the restaurant, which would put many more expensive hotels to shame.. Beds are comfortable with spotless white linen, the televisions are brand new, large and boast all Freeview channels. In the bathroom are soft snow white towels and continuous hot water. Now obviously if all was perfect it would have a higher rating but if you want cheap and cheerful and excellent value De Trafford takes some beating. For me some improvements that would have little cost would be, a mirror over the dressing table, shelving in the bathroom to put toiletries on and more storage space for non-hanging clothing. A display of local tourist attractions would also be appreciated. Most lasting impression though was of a happy weekend being well cared for by this excellent team of staff.

Punters at a knocking shop wouldnât be happy those beds. 2) rubber seal on the window shot to bits so the traffic from the main road is very noisy. 3) the bath panel was half held on by half peeling away masking tape. 4) not all the lights worked. data.text:
Me and the good wife checked in for 2 nights to visit family in Manchester (easy train ride way ) and have to say we have found the hotel wonderful and clean  and the food was excellant
on arrival we were 2 hours early for check in   this wasnt a problem and the room was ready we was warned the cleaning staff would still be about .so when we went to the room the cleaning staff were there and so so apologetic for been in  our way   when actually it was us in their way  so friendly and lovely they were ..so a great start for us and it has just got better and better   .such a huge massive bed and spotless clean room and hotel   ..receptionist is very helpful welcoming  and a pleasure to speak to . the staff were all super  ..happy, helpful and perfect  (I'm just sorry I didn't get all your names I was hungover the second day lol )  and then we came across Helen on the bar  well what can I say  just superb ..
we travelled 375 miles to come here  and I guarantee we will be back ..
thank you everyone at de Trafford  you have such a wonderful clean place ..

But they seem to have major staffing or management issues which causes certain times of day to just be absolutely terrible service, stuff like missing meals from an order, or (should be) hot food brought to the table freezing cold.

data.text: Perfect for what we needed. Rooms are comfortable and clean. Quiet basic but it's obvious that they replaced and up keep the rooms. White blinds and shower curtains looks pristine and brand new. The light bulbs are quiet dull and yellow which makes it hard to get ready in winter as it goes dark at 4pm but location is the best in the area. Right in the heart of the village high street. Bargain at the price I paid and I booked last minute. Reception staff said I might have got it even cheaper if I'd have booked in advance. Would definitely recommend. My only regret is I didn't get chance to dine in the pub. The food looked amazing
